thread.title: Flooding unearths coffins in South Carolina
thread.title_full: Flooding unearths coffins in South Carolina | www.palmbeachpost.com

author: Cox Media Group National Content Desk
title: Flooding unearths coffins in South Carolina
text:
Historic flooding is having a disturbing result in South Carolina cemeteries.
Floodwaters are causing caskets to be unearthed.
>> Read more trending stories
At least two coffins floated this weekend at Springfield Cemetery in Orangeburg, S.C., WJBF reported.
The rainfall and water have saturated the ground. The pressure pushes the coffins to the surface.
From: Kim Boston - Caskets floating in the Springfield Cemetery, Samaria Road in Orangeburg. #SCFlood #SEFlood pic.twitter.com/VQm2h4GAjT
— Daniel Bonds (@Daniel_Bonds) October 4, 2015 It isn't only shocking to see the final resting places of the departed disturbed; it can also be a health risk.
The water can spread the chemicals used in embalming, Mashable reported.
